intro: Fleischmannia holwayana, commonly known as the holwayana fleischmannia, is a species of flowering plant in the nightshade family, Solanaceae. It is native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that are typically violet or purple in color. It has adapted to survive in dry environments with its succulent leaves and deep root system. Fleischmannia holwayana is often found growing in rocky soils and is a popular plant among desert gardeners.
